position.marginalia_text: Venetia[e] victa[e]. Ergò nerui belloru[m], no[n] nummi, sed uiri.

marginalia.translation: Venice defeated. Thus the muscles in war are not coins but men.

position.marginalia_text: Qui non potest plus; erubescat, et abeat.

marginalia.translation: He who can go no further blushes and leaves.

position.marginalia_text: Solus mundi proficiens, qui bona animi, corporis, fortuna[e] in dies singulos, in horasq[ue] singulas multiplicat.

marginalia.translation: The only one in the world who makes progress is he who multiplies the goods of mind, body, and fortune each day and each hour.

position.marginalia_text: Nihil turpius, quàm esse ullo die non proficientem.

marginalia.translation: Nothing is more wretched than not making progress on any day.
Daily exercise is necessary for the pragmatic man.

position.marginalia_text: in pettie quarrels, lesse then a man: in maine quarrels, more then a man.
Quotiana Corporis, animiq[ue] Exercitatio, tam necessaria industrio actori, quàm ipse panis quotidianus. Egregiè Vegetius: Veteranus, cum desinit exercere, tyro est.

marginalia.translation: Daily exercise of the body and mind is as necessary for the industrious actor as is his daily bread. He is notably more energetic. When the veteran ceases to exercise, he becomes a novice.
